p: The results of our survey show a poor level of knowledge of recommended prescription modifications in older subjects with impaired kidney function among both 4th year medical students and physician-trainees in internal medicine ( Table 2). The most striking examples are sotalol, metoclopramide and nitrofurantoin, correctly classified as drugs that should be avoided in such patients by only one of eight physicians and students. The extreme poor knowledge of these contraindications is the more surprising that all these three medications are quite commonly used in older patients. 20 Frequent use of nitrofurantoin in patients with CKD was reported by Farag et al 25 in a retrospective analysis of antibiotics prescribing in Canada.
